tweets.text: Lovely day and evening, cannot open any windows. It absolutely stinks outside and invading the flat again. We cant open windows on a day temp over 20C outside. This isn't healthy. It is a public health emergency @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @MPGeorgeEustice @MattHancock @StinkStopthe https://t.co/dQRcjs1gru

Thank you @ShaunLintern. 

I will be releasing my Health and Impact Survey report later today. Of the 1,426 responses:

52% reported a significant or severe impact on their physical health

urls.title: Protecting ourselves and each other as we move out of lockdown
urls.description: On 22 February 2021, the Government published its ‚ÄòRoadmap out of Lockdown‚Äô which set out how national coronavirus restrictions would be eased in stages, with reviews taking place on set dates. This blog looks at how easing of restrictions will work and why we must keep following the rules to keep each other safe.

tweets.text: @RussellB1ggs @WasteCrimeWatch @EnvAgency And where were the EA?  And with this evidential footage what action are the EA taking?????
@EnvAgencyMids "We are considering" I am sure the people considering legal action, or suicide are not impressed with your lack of action. ! Again pathetic.

@EnvAgencyMids You are stalling til 2026, fooling no one, stench is worse than ever since fresh air Friday, a massive fail from you all, hang you heads in shame, not fit for purpose organisation @AaronBell4NUL will hold you to account #stopthestink

@EnvAgencyMids This says you regulate the permits you issue through monitoring and visits. Which means you are blind to anything that happens in between. I'm very surprised that monitoring of air quality isn't a permanent feature, so that you can fully and properly discharge your duties

@EnvAgencyMids This monitoring does not consider the impact to health in the home where wind does not clear it. Once it enters its hard to clear. Been in my house for 2 days and struggled to clear it out even with doors open (no smell outside). It IS having a short term health impact on me.

@EnvAgencyMids Final reply. You may have seen their response to the latest article in The Independent. They are hiding behind you. Your complacency has led them to believe they can get away with anything. Start taking real action.

tweets.text:
Ahead of #WorldOceanDay, we've developed an interactive tool for primary and secondary school students to show how plastic pollution travels to the ocean.

If you're a teacher, parent or guardian, read more here:
https://t.co/YvPDT5eR45 

@Plastic_EU #STEMEducation https://t.co/aU627GeQJx

urls.title: Environment Agency launches educational tools for WOD to ‚Äòhelp marine life thrive‚Äô - Preventing Plastic Pollution
urls.description: Schools across England will mark World Ocean Day (WOD) next month (Tuesday, June 8) by exploring the journey of plastic with the Environment Agency. Primary and secondary schools are invited to view a series of online films and activities via an interactive map in advance of the event, culminating in a live question and answer sessio n with Environment Agency and World Wildlife Fund experts on the actual day. By clicking on different points of the map, students can learn how plastic pollution travels
